info.game_comments:
Eric Berman game 4.
J! round and 15 clues of DJ! round only.

(1, 1).clue: The 1st publication to call itself a "magazine" was printed in 1731 in this country

(3, 1).clue: Series that featured Sister Sixto, Sister Jacqueline & Sister Bertrille

(4, 1).clue: 1 of 2 countries, 1 Balkan, 1 Middle Eastern, with which the hora is associated

(5, 1).clue: Of a barnacle, binnacle, or carbuncle, the one you'd find most useful aboard ship

(6, 1).clue: Though the Bedlington terrier looks like this wooly mammal, it was bred to hunt foxes & badgers

(1, 2).clue: In the early 20th c., this mid-morning institution was reputedly begun at an American Rolls-Royce factory

(2, 2).clue: Lord Byron's poem "The Island" was based on this famous mutiny

(3, 2).clue: Her resemblance to Carol Burnett led to role of Carol's kid sister Chrissy on "The Carol Burnett Show"

(4, 2).clue: It's the name of both this song & the dance done to it:

(5, 2).clue: Of a witch, waterfowl, or way out, what you're looking for if you're looking for a egress

(6, 2).clue: "The fastest mouse in all Mexico", his 2nd role was in a 1955 Oscar-winning cartoon

(1, 3).clue: Introduced by brother of famed Civil War general, it was America's 1st antitrust law

(2, 3).clue: 1 of the 1st Pacific islands to be settled by Europeans, Guam was colonized by this country by the 1690s

(3, 3).clue: This TV "boy" had 3 younger sisters named Erin, Elizabeth & Mary Ellen

(4, 3).clue: Many of this country's dances act out the life of god Krishna

(5, 3).clue: Of a buttock, futtock, or fetlock, the 1 not found on a horse

(6, 3).clue: Found primarily in Siberia, this species is the marten most valued for its fur

(1, 4).clue: In 1938, Don Budge became 1st & only U.S. male to accomplish this feat in tennis

(2, 4).clue: The name of this famous World War II site means "sulfur island" in Japanese

(5, 4).clue: Of ex parte, ex libris, or ex post facto, the 1 that's not a legal term

(1, 5).clue: The 1st congregational church in America was founded by Wm. Bradford & this group he led

(2, 5).clue: The 2nd largest island in the Mediterranean

(3, 5).clue: The 2 stars of "Charlie's Angels" whose characters were sisters

(5, 5).clue: Of polydactyl, polydipsic, or polydemic, what you'd be if you were stranded in the desert without water

(2, 1).clue: Tennessee Williams set "The Glass Menagerie" in this Missouri city where he grew up

(3, 1).clue: Country band appropriately named since their "home's in Alabama"

(4, 1).clue: In 1977, he became 1st person to be both president of USSR & head of the Communist party

(6, 1).clue: Another name for the poisonous water moccasin snake of the Southeast U.S.

(2, 2).clue: Geo. B. Shaw's "Heartbreak House" was inspired by this author's "3 Sisters" & "Cherry Orchard"

(3, 2).clue: Named for NYC borough, the R&B group has been a "Shining Star" in music for 20 years

(4, 2).clue: In 1959, posters of an actress in a bathing suit were painted over when this pope drove thru Rome

(6, 2).clue: In song, they were located "Down in Louisiana just a mile from Texarkana"

(2, 3).clue: Title of a Ferber-Kaufman play about struggling actresses, or where you'd bring them flowers

(3, 3).clue: Folk trio that chose their name because Calypso music was in vogue when they formed

(4, 3).clue: Ironically, in the late '20s, the U.S. helped supervise elections in this Central American nation

(2, 4).clue: Commedia dell'Arte sweetheart in the original Harlequin romances

(3, 4).clue: John Ford Coley & this "Britisher" teamed in the '70s & found "Love is the Answer"

(2, 5).clue: Abbie Cabot tempts her stepson Eben beneath the trees in this O'Neill tragedy

(3, 5).clue: "Almost Paradise", the love theme from "Footloose", was sung by Heart's Ann Wilson & this leading Loverboy
